lines.content: #### Pikachu helps you keep organised by recording your daily tasks and displaying them on command! :yellow_heart:

* Returns list of tasks in chronologically sorted order.

* Marks a given task as done.
* @return String containing confirmation of the marked task.
return "Pikachu has marked this task as done!\n   > " + t;
* Marks a given task as undone.
* @return String containing confirmation of the unmarked task.
return "Pikachu has marked this task as not done yet!\n   > " + t;
* Deletes a given task from the tasklist.
* @return String containing confirmation of the deleted task.
return "Pikachu has deleted this task!\n   > " + t + "\n"
+ "You now have " + inputList.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* @return String containing information of the created ToDo task.
return "Pikachu has added this task to the list!\n" + "   > " + t + "\n"
+ "You now have " + inputList.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* @return String containing information of the created Deadline task.
return "Pikachu has added this task to the list!\n" + "   > " + d + "\n"
+ "You now have " + inputList.size() + " tasks in the list.";
return "Task description is empty/Empty or invalid deadline timing has been specified!";
* Syntax: event <taskname> /<yyyy-mm-dd hhmm of start> <yymmdd hhmm of end>
* @return String containing information of the created Event task.
return "End time cannot be earlier than start time!";

return "Pikachu has added this task to the list!\n" + "   > " + e + "\n"
+ "You now have " + inputList.size() + " tasks in the list.";
return "Task description is empty/Empty or invalid event duration has been specified!";

* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Initializes the Pikachu chatbot, printing greeting message and setting certain styling properties.
public void setDuke(Duke d) throws IOException {
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
//Gives time for user to see goodbye message
* Prints to both terminal and GUI the greeting message sent when first starting up the application.
* @return Greeting string to be printed in GUI.

String result = "Pika Pika! 
Pikachu says hi! 
To see available commands, type 'commands'.
";
//Prints the Pikachu ASCII on top of the greeting message in terminal
* Prints to both terminal and GUI the list of available user commands.
* @return String of list of commands to be printed in GUI.
result = ("The available commands are:\ncommands: See list of commands\n"
+ "list: See list of current tasks. Syntax: list\n");
result += ("sort: Sorts list of current tasks by chronological order. Syntax: sort\n");
result += ("mark: Mark a task as completed. Syntax: mark <index of task>\n");
result += ("unmark: Mark a task as not completed. Syntax: unmark <index of task>\n");
result += ("delete: Delete a task. Syntax: delete <index of task>\n");
result += ("todo: Create a todo task. Syntax: todo <taskname>\n");
result += ("deadline: Create a deadline. Syntax: deadline <taskname> /<yyyy-mm-dd hhmm of deadline>\n");
result += ("event: Create an event. Syntax: event <taskname> "
+ "/<yyyy-mm-dd hhmm of start> <yymmdd hhmm of end>\n");
result += ("find: Search for tasks containing a given keyword. Syntax: find <keyword>\n");
result += ("bye: Exits the application. Syntax: bye\n");
* Prints to both terminal and GUI the goodbye message sent when closing the application.
* @return Goodbye string to be printed in GUI.
